net.dnddev.factions.base

Interface Faction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Messageable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LoadFaction, MongoFaction

    public interface Faction
extends Messageable
    The base entity that this API is based around.

    Factions are groups of Users that work together to play within a Minecraft server. Factions can claim land, have a home, set warps, create outposts, and much more.

    Author:
    Michael Ziluck

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Faction.Type
      Represents the purpose for each Faction.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAnnouncement(String message)
      Add a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to all members.

      This will automatically send the message to all online members of the Faction and store it for all offline members for the next time they join.
      void addAnnouncement(String message, List<User> users)
      Add a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to the specified Faction members.

      This will automatically send the message to all online targeted members of the Faction and store it for all offline targeted members for the next time they join.
      void addAnnouncement(String message, Role role)
      Add a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to all members with the specified rank.
      void addAnnouncement(String message, Role role, boolean superiors)
      Adds a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to all members with the specified rank with the ability to include superiors.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.dnddev.factions.base.Messageable

        sendMessage, sendMessage, sendMessage

    • Method Detail

      • getUniqueId

        UUID getUniqueId()
        Retrieves the unique id of the Faction. This is generated when the Faction is created and will not be reused. Wilderness will always have a UUID of ffffffff-ffff-ffff-ffff-ffffffffffff.
        Returns:
        the uuid of the Faction.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Retrieves the case-sensitive name of the Faction. This should not be used for lookup as requiring case-sensitivity is a pain for users. For lookup, use getStub().
        Returns:
        the name of the Faction.

      • getStub

        String getStub()
        Retrieves the lower cased name of the Faction. This should be used primarily for lookup.
        Returns:
        the lower case name of the Faction

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Retrieves the description for the Faction. Colors for this can be toggled on and off in the config.yml.
        Returns:
        the description of the Faction.

      • getMOTD

        String getMOTD()
        Retrieves the message of the day for the Faction. This is what is sent to players each time they connect to the server. Sending this every time they connect or once per 24-hours can be set in the config. Colors for this can be toggled on and off in the config.yml.
        Returns:
        the motd of the Faction.

      • getAnnouncements

        Multimap<UUID,String> getAnnouncements()
        Retrieves all announcements for each player. Announcements are messages stored with the data that are going to be sent to the players the next time they connect to the server. Players that are currently connected to the server should not have any pending announcements as any new announcement added for a player is sent to them immediately.
        Returns:
        the pending announcements.

      • addAnnouncement

        void addAnnouncement(String message,
                     List<User> users)
        Add a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to the specified Faction members.

        This will automatically send the message to all online targeted members of the Faction and store it for all offline targeted members for the next time they join.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be announced.
        users - the users to receive the message.

      • addAnnouncement

        void addAnnouncement(String message)
        Add a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to all members.

        This will automatically send the message to all online members of the Faction and store it for all offline members for the next time they join.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be announced.

      • addAnnouncement

        void addAnnouncement(String message,
                     Role role)
        Add a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to all members with the specified rank. Important note: this will not send it to the rank's superiors as well. To also send to superiors, use addAnnouncement(String, Role, boolean).

        This will automatically send the message to all online targeted members of the Faction and store it for all offline targeted members for the next time they join.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be announced.
        role - the role to receive the message.

      • addAnnouncement

        void addAnnouncement(String message,
                     Role role,
                     boolean superiors)
        Adds a new announcement for the Faction to be sent to all members with the specified rank with the ability to include superiors. This will automatically send the message to all online targeted members of the Faction and store it for all offline targeted members for the next time they join.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be announced.
        role - the to receive message.
        superiors - whether or not to also send to the role's superiors.

      • removeAnnouncements

        void removeAnnouncements(User user)
        Remove all announcements for the specified user. This will have no effect on online users as they won't have any pending announcements.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to clear.

      • getWarps

        Collection<Warp> getWarps()
        Retrieves all the warps that this Faction has saved. Each warp has a name that is case insensitive, but should still maintain case when stored in the system.
        Returns:
        all Faction warps.

      • getWarp

        Warp getWarp(String name)
        Gets a warp by the given name. This method is case-insensitive. If there is no warp found by the given name, returns null.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to search for.
        Returns:
        the warp.

      • isWarp

        boolean isWarp(String name)
        Checks if there is a warp by the given name. This method is case-insensitive and uses Warp.getStub(). Most cases this method is not necessary to be called as performing a null check with the method getWarp(String) should give the exact same behavior.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to search for.
        Returns:
        true if the warp exists.

      • setWarp

        Warp setWarp(String name,
             LazyLocation location,
             String password)
        Creates a new warp for the Faction with the given name, location, and password. If the password is null it simply is not stored.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the warp.
        location - the location of the warp.
        password - the password for the warp.
        Returns:
        the newly created warp.

      • setWarp

        Warp setWarp(String name,
             LazyLocation location)
        Creates a new password-less warp for the Faction with the given name and location.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the warp.
        location - the location of the warp.
        Returns:
        the newly created warp.

      • removeWarp

        boolean removeWarp(String name)
        Removes the warp referenced by the given name. This method is case-insensitive and uses Warp.getStub(). This action is permanent so be sure that all necessary checks are done first.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to search for.
        Returns:
        true if there was a Faction to remove.

      • clearWarps

        void clearWarps()
        Removes all the warps from the Faction. This action is permanent so be sure that all necessary checks are done first.

      • getHome

        LazyLocation getHome()
        Get the LazyLocation for the Faction's home.
        Returns:
        the home.

      • setHome

        void setHome(LazyLocation home)
        Sets a new LazyLocation for the Faction's home.
        Parameters:
        home - the new home.

      • getLeader

        User getLeader()
        Retrieves the leader of the Faction. This is the only member-related method that does not search through the members to find who we are looking for.
        Returns:
        the leader of the Faction.

      • getAdmins

        List<User> getAdmins()
        Retrieves all the admins of the Faction. This is a shorthand method for retrieving all members and filtering out all non-admins. If there are no admins, this will return an empty list. Important note: this will return only the admins, not any member who is an admin or higher.
        Returns:
        all admins of the Faction.

      • getModerators

        List<User> getModerators()
        Retrieves all the moderators of the Faction. This is a shorthand method for retrieving all members and filtering out all non-moderators. If there are no moderators, this will return an empty list. Important note: this will return only the moderators, not any member who is a moderator or higher.
        Returns:
        all moderators of the Faction.

      • getMembers

        List<User> getMembers()
        Retrieves all the members of the Faction. This includes the leader.

        This method is lazy loading by default, meaning that it will only load the members when it is called for the first time rather than when it is started. This ensures that unnecessary memory is not used up to ensure it is as efficient as possible. This feature can be turned off in the config, but it is advisable to be left on.
        Returns:
        all members of the Faction.

      • getMembers

        List<User> getMembers(Role role)
        Retrieves all the members who have the specific rank. This is a shorthand method for retrieving all members and filter out all members who aren't the specified role. If there are no members with that role, this will return an empty list. Important note: this will return only the members with the specified role, not those at or above the role.
        Parameters:
        role - the role to look for.
        Returns:
        the members with the given faction role.

      • getTrialMembers

        List<User> getTrialMembers()
        Retrieves all the trials members of the Faction. This is a shorthand method for retrieving all members and filtering out all non-trial-members. If there are no trial members, this will return an empty list. Important note: this will return only trial-members, not any member who is trial or higher.
        Returns:
        the trial members.

      • getType

        Faction.Type getType()
        Retrieves the Faction.Type of the Faction.
        Returns:
        the Faction Type.

      • isWilderness

        boolean isWilderness()
        Checks if this is the Wilderness. The Wilderness will always have a UUID of ffffffff-ffff-ffff-ffff-ffffffffffff.
        Returns:
        true if this is the Wilderness.

      • isNormal

        boolean isNormal()
        Checks if this is a Normal Faction. This means that it is a Faction created by a User. Normal Factions be permanent or non-permanent, as well as peaceful and non-peaceful.
        Returns:
        true if this is a Normal Faction.

      • isWarzone

        boolean isWarzone()
        Checks if this is a Warzone. This means it is a system Faction created by an administrator. Warzones will not have a leader or members.
        Returns:
        true if this is a Warzone Faction.

      • isSafezone

        boolean isSafezone()
        Checks if this is a Safezone. This means it is a system Faction created by an administrator. Safezones will not have a leader or members.
        Returns:
        true if this is a Safezone Faction.

      • isPermanent

        boolean isPermanent()
        Checks if this Faction is permanent. Non-permanent Factions have an expiration date and will be disbanded once that date is reached.
        Returns:
        true if this Faction is permanent.

      • isPeaceful

        boolean isPeaceful()
        Checks if this Faction is peaceful. Peaceful Factions are not able to partake in PVP. Additionally peaceful Factions are able to use several more flags that they are not able to normally use.
        Returns:
        true if this Faction is peaceful.

      • addInvite

        void addInvite(User user)
        Add an invite for the given User. For non-open factions, adding an invite for a User is the only way to allow players to join a Faction.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to add an invite for.

      • removeInvite

        void removeInvite(User user)
        Remove an existing invite for the given User.
        Parameters:
        user - the user whose invite to remove.

      • hasInvite

        boolean hasInvite(User user)
        Checks if the given User has an existing invite.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to check.
        Returns:
        true if the User has an invite.

      • getInvites

        List<UUID> getInvites()
        Retrieves all existing invites for this Faction. This list should not be modified directly as it can cause unexpected side effects. Use addInvite(User) and removeInvite(User) instead.
        Returns:
        the invites for this faction.

      • save

        void save()
        Saves this Faction instance to the designated form of storage. This method will run asynchronously to ensure that it does not cause hesitation in the main thread. This means that saving very often causes no issues except traffic either to the database or the file system itself. Regardless, it should still be used sparingly to ensure as much efficiency as possible.
